item.title: Walk through Iceberg metadata contents by creating tables, modifying schema and write mode, and writing data in Spark
item.description:
Apache Iceberg is a table format that enables efficient processing of large-scale data. It enables to do Schema Evolution which allows changing table schemas without modifying source data, time travel, and directory-independent pruning through Hidden Partitioning, and can be referenced from various systems including Spark, Trino, and Snowflake.

Creating tables

Using the docker-compose.yml from the Quickstart, you can easily try it out as it launches a Jupyter Notebook with Iceberg configured as Spark’s default catalog, along with MinIO, an S3-compatible storage.
